intro: Petiveria octandra, commonly known as wild betel, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Petiveria octandra is also valued for its role in local ecosystems and as a source of natural fibers.
